parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Spack",
  "details": {
    "job_name": "mpip@3.5",
    "account": "sdsc",
    "partition": "hotel",
    "nodes": 1,
    "tasks_per_node": 1,
    "cpus_per_task": 10,
    "memory": "93G",
    "gpus": 1,
    "time": "00:30:00",
    "output": "%x.o%j.%N",
    "scheduler_module": "slurm/expanse/current",
    "spack_version": "0.17.3",
    "spack_instance_name": "gpu",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/gpu",
    "intel_license_file": "40000@elprado.sdsc.edu:40200@elprado.sdsc.edu",
    "spack_package": "mpip@3.5",
    "spack_compiler": "intel@19.1.1.217",
    "spack_variants": "~add_shared_target ~bfd ~demangling +libunwind +mpi_io +mpi_nbc +mpi_rma ~setjmp",
    "spack_dependencies": "^openmpi@4.1.3/$(spack find --format '{hash:7}' openmpi@4.1.3 % ${SPACK_COMPILER})",
    "spack_spec": "${SPACK_PACKAGE} % ${SPACK_COMPILER} ${SPACK_VARIANTS} ${SPACK_DEPENDENCIES}"
  }
}
```

This script utilizes **Spack** for managing software packages. It defines several variables related to the job environment, including the job name, account, partition, and resource allocation settings. It also specifies the Spack version, instance name, and installation directory. 

The script performs the following actions:

1. **Environment setup**: It loads the necessary modules (slurm and spack) and sets up the Spack environment.
2. **Package installation**: It defines the desired package (mpip@3.5) with specific compiler, variants, and dependencies. It uses Spack to concretize the specification and install the package with the specified number of parallel jobs.
3. **Subsequent job submission**: After successful installation, it submits another job ('tau@2.30.2.sh') as a dependency of the current job.

The script relies on the **Slurm** workload manager to manage the job execution and resources. It utilizes Spack commands to install and manage software packages. The dependencies defined in the script ensure the required software components are available and compatible with each other.
